course_title: Topics in Computer Science: Deep Learning
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 30 / Seats Avail: 30Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Prerequisite: CS 334 and familiarity with python programming


Department permission required, please email bnflood@emory.edu


Deep Learning systems, typified by deep neural networks, are increasingly taking over all AI tasks, ranging from language understanding, speech and image recognition, to machine translation, planning, and even game playing and autonomous driving. In this course, you will learn the foundations of Deep Learning, understand how to build neural networks, and apply them to a variety of tasks. You will learn about multi-layer perceptrons, convolutional neural networks, recurrent neural networks, graph neural networks, transformers, generative models (VAE/GAN), back-propagation and stochastic gradient descent, activation functions, Xavier initialization, Adam optimizer, Dropout, BatchNorm, deep reinforcement learning, and more.
course_description: May be repeated for credit when topic varies. Pre/co-requisites vary with topic.
schedule_location: TTh 10am-11:15am in Math & Science Center - W201
